title.narrative: Opportunities for youth in Africa: Accelerating job creation in agriculture and agribusiness

description.narrative: A loud call for accelerating efforts in the area job creation for youth through agribusiness was made during a recent Conference on Youth Employment in Agriculture co-organized by the African Union, the Government of Rwanda and FAO. The event took place in August 2018 (20th – 21st) in Kigali/Rwanda with the theme: “Youth Employment in Agriculture as a Solid Solution to Ending Hunger and Poverty in Africa: Engaging through Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs) and Entrepreneurship”. The conference was attended by more than 400 participants, including about 250 youth from 40 countries, high-level government officials, representatives of the private sector, senior and principal representatives of international and regional organizations, including UNIDO’s Director General. The conference was followed by an expression of interest by the Government of Japan support a UNIDO-FAO a join program on youth employment in Africa. Based on this, the proposed project "Opportunities for Youth in Africa (OYA): Accelerating job creation in agriculture and agribusiness" was developed, responding to the opportunity presented by Japan. In addition to the support expressed by the Government of Japan, the initiative will also allow the mobilization of other donors, elevating it to a multi-donor and multi-agency initiative that is aligned with the management priorities of scale up and increased impact. Additionally, the initiative is line with the pillars of the Tokyo International Conference on African Development (TICAD), which includes Economic Transformation and Inclusive Growth highlighting the central role of agriculture and food value chains for Africa’s growth and development and for improved food security and rural livelihoods, while emphasizing the need for continuous empowerment of youth. Consequently, a proposal has been submitted for the organization of a joint FAO and UNIDO side event during TICAD VII in August 2019 as a platform to launch the initiative. The proposed initiative falls within the strong partnership established with FAO in the area of agribusiness (3ADI) and aims at scaling up the respective technical assistance good practices in Africa to boost employment through innovative approaches for integration of youth in the economic development of the target countries, including through circular economy, smart manufacturing, SME development and value chain development. The initiative proposes an integrated approach for the promotion of quality on- and off-farm employment opportunities in agriculture and agribusiness in Africa in rural and peri-rural areas, with a focus on youth. The integrated nature of the approach refers to its multilevel scope (regional, national and local), and to the integration of the core functions of UNIDO and FAO, and additional potential partners that may be identified. These functions mainly include knowledge generation, policy and technical assistance, support for access to finance, capacity development in areas such as employment and entrepreneurship, value chain development, sustainable agriculture and agribusiness, and social protection.
